instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2914: What is 820-2914? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_RESET_L: What is SMC_RESET_L? SMC_RESET_L puts the SMC into reset mode when it is low, _L means the signal is present when voltage is low. The SMC being in reset mode keeps it from running..
definitions.PPVCORE_GPU: What is PPVCORE_GPU? This is the main power rail for the GPU. This is required for the GPU to turn on so you can get image on the display. .
definitions.C9560: What is C9560? Tantalum capacitor on 820-2850 logic board that often dies and causes intermittent power to framebuffer PP1V8R1V55_S0GPU_ISNS and PP1V8R1V55_S0GPU_ISNS_R rail, causing GPU kernel panics. Replace with non-tantalum if machine is having random black screen or kernel panics.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no chime.
threads.message:
No liquid.

Fan spins up and stays spinning, no light on USB mouse, no chime.


PPBUS 12V6
CPU vcore = 1v1 (then drops to 0.79v)
<CAPACITOR>C9560</CAPACITOR> voltage 1V39
<SIGNAL>PPVCORE_GPU</SIGNAL> 1V1

<SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> = 3V3

SPIROM chip is good

I'll test some more but any thoughts so far please?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no chime.
threads.message: If CPU Vcore drops it is booting to some extent. Heated the GPU yet?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no chime.
threads.message:
[QUOTE="dukefawks, post: 16265"]If CPU Vcore drops it is booting to some extent. Heated the GPU yet?[/QUOTE]

It's a bad GPU.... I'll slap another one on there.
Thanks Duke.
